definition: (coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
small arched door/boudoir/lady's chamber/by ext. women

sentences.english: Or maybe you're always blanking out on your buddy's husband's name.
sentences.chinese: 或者你总是记不起来你闺蜜老公的名字？

sentences.english: Bestie, in fact, is another own.
sentences.chinese: 闺蜜，其实就是另一个自己。

sentences.english: Today i went to kyoto again to see geisha dance, with Noriko and Rie.
sentences.chinese: 今天和两个日本闺蜜一起去京都看艺妓表演的舞蹈。

sentences.english: She and I than what, even if I was her best ie.
sentences.chinese: 她什么都要和我比，即使我是她闺蜜。

sentences.english: And, in common with many of my friend's husbands, Colin regularly complains that this just isn't enough.
sentences.chinese: 跟我很多闺蜜的老公一样，科林也常常对此牢骚满腹。

definition: older female cousin via female line
good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
(dialect) close childhood friend whom one grew up with/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
